Description: Stem and tondo sherd of Attic red-figured pottery kylix, probably type B; interior: red-figure decoration consisting of komos scene; part of a draped man or youth moving to left with right leg advanced, cloak draped over left arm and falling in front and behind; dilute brown for ribs (four loops) and median line; part of undetermined object on left beside figure at level of upper arm; exterior: glazed black save reserved edge to jog on top of foot; interior of stem black save for upper part.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: The figure was possibly looking right, perhaps with a wineskin slung over his right shoulder. For parallels regarding the figure, see Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 301.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 511, no. C76)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0661) (Phase 1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens
